messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

opt: /tmp/llvm-gh-134115/build/llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h:36: llvm::ConstantRangeList::ConstantRangeList(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::ConstantRange>): Assertion `isOrderedRanges(RangesRef)' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/opt -p function-attrs /testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll -disable-output
1.	Running pass "cgscc(function-attrs)" on module "/testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll"
    - llvm::sys::PrintStackTrace(llvm::raw_ostream&, int) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:804:22
    - PrintStackTraceSignalHandler(void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:880:1
    - llvm::sys::RunSignalHandlers() llvm/lib/Support/Signals.cpp:105:20
    - SignalHandler(int, siginfo_t*, void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:418:13
    - llvm::ConstantRangeList::ConstantRangeList(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::ConstantRange>) llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h:37:35
    - (anonymous namespace)::getArgumentAccessInfo(llvm::Instruction const*, (anonymous namespace)::ArgumentUse const&, llvm::DataLayout const&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:700:73
    - (anonymous namespace)::collectArgumentUsesPerBlock(llvm::Argument&, llvm::Function&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:809:34
    - inferInitializes(llvm::Argument&, llvm::Function&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:1108:21
    - addArgumentAttrs(llvm::SmallSetVector<llvm::Function*, 8u> const&, llvm::SmallSet<llvm::Function*, 8u, std::less<llvm::Function*>>&, bool) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:1305:9
    - llvm::SmallSet<llvm::Function*, 8u, std::less<llvm::Function*>> deriveAttrsInPostOrder<llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&)::'lambda'(llvm::Function&)&>(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Function*>, llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&)::'lambda'(llvm::Function&)&, bool) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:2266:18
    - llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:2323:29
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/lib/Analysis/CGSCCPassManager.cpp:93:12
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::PassManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::ModuleToPostOrderCGSCCPassAdaptor::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/lib/Analysis/CGSCCPassManager.cpp:280:18
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::Module, llvm::ModuleToPostOrderCGSCCPassAdaptor, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::Module, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerImpl.h:85:18
    - llvm::runPassPipeline(llvm::StringRef, llvm::Module&, llvm::TargetMachine*, llvm::TargetLibraryInfoImpl*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::StringRef, llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::PassPlugin>, llvm::ArrayRef<std::function<void (llvm::PassBuilder&)>>, llvm::opt_tool::OutputKind, llvm::opt_tool::VerifierKind, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool) llvm/tools/opt/NewPMDriver.cpp:557:10
    - optMain llvm/tools/opt/optdriver.cpp:725:27
    - main llvm/tools/opt/opt.cpp:25:64

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

 1| //===- ConstantRangeList.h - A list of constant ranges ----------*- C++ -*-===//
 2| //
 3| // Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.
 4| // See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.
 5| // SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception

 7| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
 8| //
 9| // Represent a list of signed ConstantRange and do NOT support wrap around the
10| // end of the numeric range. Ranges in the list are ordered and not overlapping.
11| // Ranges should have the same bitwidth. Each range's lower should be less than
12| // its upper.
13| //
14| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
15|

23| #include <cstdint>
24| 
25| namespace llvm {
26| 
27| class raw_ostream;
28| 
29| /// This class represents a list of constant ranges.
30| class [[nodiscard]] ConstantRangeList {
31|   SmallVector<ConstantRange, 2> Ranges;
32| 
33| public:
34|   ConstantRangeList() = default;
35|   ConstantRangeList(ArrayRef<ConstantRange> RangesRef) {

Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 81 to line 120 in llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRange.h:
 81| 
 82|   /// Create non-empty constant range with the given bounds. If Lower and
 83|   /// Upper are the same, a full range is returned.
 84|   static ConstantRange getNonEmpty(APInt Lower, APInt Upper) {
 85|     if (Lower == Upper)
 86|       return getFull(Lower.getBitWidth());
 87|     return ConstantRange(std::move(Lower), std::move(Upper));
 88|   }
 89| 
 90|   /// Initialize a range based on a known bits constraint. The IsSigned flag
 91|   /// indicates whether the constant range should not wrap in the signed or
 92|   /// unsigned domain.
 93|   static ConstantRange fromKnownBits(const KnownBits &Known, bool IsSigned);
 94| 
 95|   /// Split the ConstantRange into positive and negative components, ignoring
 96|   /// zero values.
 97|   std::pair<ConstantRange, ConstantRange> splitPosNeg() const;
 98| 
 99|   /// Produce the smallest range such that all values that may satisfy the given
100|   /// predicate with any value contained within Other is contained in the
101|   /// returned range.  Formally, this returns a superset of
102|   /// 'union over all y in Other . { x : icmp op x y is true }'.  If the exact
103|   /// answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value will be a
104|   /// proper superset of the above.
105|   ///
106|   /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 [2, 5) returns Result = [0, 4)
107|   static ConstantRange makeAllowedICmpRegion(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
108|                                              const ConstantRange &Other);
109| 
110|   /// Produce the largest range such that all values in the returned range
111|   /// satisfy the given predicate with all values contained within Other.
112|   /// Formally, this returns a subset of
113|   /// 'intersection over all y in Other . { x : icmp op x y is true }'.  If the
114|   /// exact answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value
115|   /// will be a proper subset of the above.
116|   ///
117|   /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 [2, 5) returns [0, 2)
118|   static ConstantRange makeSatisfyingICmpRegion(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
119|                                                 const ConstantRange &Other);
120|
